byline.contributor: William Neuman and Carolina Loza contributed reporting.

abstract: Pope Francis addresses exploitation of Amazon rain forest during his visit to Ecuador, in implicit rebuke of economic and environmental policies of Pres Rafael Correa; statements were expected, following environmental encyclical released worldwide in June that discussed climate change as a social issue and linked environmental destruction to plight of poor.
lead_paragraph: Francis declared that the country must resist exploiting natural riches for “short-term benefits,” an implicit rebuke of President Rafael Correa’s policies.

headline.main: Pope Francis, in Ecuador, Calls for More Protection of Rain Forest and Its People
